intro: Cypholophus decipiens, commonly known as the deceptive lily, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that resemble those of true lilies. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments and has a bulbous root system. Its leaves are broad and strap-like, often forming a basal rosette. Despite its attractive appearance, it is considered a rare and somewhat elusive species in the wild.
